com.st.st25sdk.command

Class VicinityMemoryCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.command.Iso15693Protocol
      • com.st.st25sdk.command.VicinityMemoryCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VicinityMemoryCommandInterface

    public class VicinityMemoryCommand
extends Iso15693Protocol
implements VicinityMemoryCommandInterface
    The VicinityMemoryCommand class implements some high level methods such as readBlocks/Bytes() and writeBlocks/Bytes() methods for Vicinity tags whatever the tag memory size

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks)
      High level blocks read function for Vicinity tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read
      ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level blocks read function for Vicinity tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, the ReadBlockResult is filled with the blockSecurityStatus byte value for each read block
      byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress, int sizeInBytes)
      High level bytes read function for Vicinity tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block
      byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress, int sizeInBytes, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level bytes read function for Vicinity tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, readBytes() will ignore it.
      byte[] readSingleBlock(int blockOffset, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Read Single Block function with blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 2-byte array value to be used with readSingleBlock function
      void setTagMaxReadMultipleBlockLength(int tagMaxReadMultipleBlockLength)
      Set the maximum number of blocks that can be read with a single readMultipleBlock command
      void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data)
      High level blocks write function for Vicinity tags This function allows to write several blocks
      void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level blocks write function for Vicinity tags This function allows to write several blocks
      void writeBytes(int byteAddress, byte[] data)
      High level byte write function for Vicinity tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modify, change the bytes to be written then write the blocks
      void writeBytes(int byteAddress, byte[] data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write function with Byte granularity
      byte writeSingleBlock(int blockOffset, byte[] buffer, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write Single Block function with blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 2-byte array value to be used with writeSingleBlock function

      • VicinityMemoryCommand

        public VicinityMemoryCommand(RFReaderInterface reader,
                             byte[] uid)
        Constructor for a VicinityMemoryCommand object
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader interface object to be used to send the commands
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)

      • VicinityMemoryCommand

        public VicinityMemoryCommand(RFReaderInterface reader,
                             byte[] uid,
                             byte flag)
        Constructor for a VicinityMemoryCommand object
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader interface object to be used to send the commands
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1

                             byte[] uid,

        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)

                             byte[] uid,
                             byte flag,
                             int nbrOfBytesPerBlock)
        Constructor for a VicinityCommand object
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader interface object to be used to send the commands
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1
        nbrOfBytesPerBlock - number of bytes per block

      • readBlocks

        public ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress,
                                  int sizeInBlocks)
                           throws STException
        High level blocks read function for Vicinity tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read
        Specified by:
        readBlocks in interface VicinityMemoryCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        firstBlockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        sizeInBlocks - Number of blocks to be read
        Returns:
        read blocks
        Throws:
        STException

      • readBlocks

        public ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress,
                                  int sizeInBlocks,
                                  byte flag,
                                  byte[] uid)
                           throws STException
        High level blocks read function for Vicinity tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, the ReadBlockResult is filled with the blockSecurityStatus byte value for each read block
        Specified by:
        readBlocks in interface VicinityMemoryCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        firstBlockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        sizeInBlocks - Number of blocks to be read
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        read blocks
        Throws:
        STException

                        int sizeInBytes)
                 throws STException

      • readBytes

        public byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress,
                        int sizeInBytes,
                        byte flag,
                        byte[] uid)
                 throws STException
        High level bytes read function for Vicinity tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, readBytes() will ignore it. To read the BSS byte, use readBlocks() instead.
        Specified by:
        readBytes in interface VicinityMemoryCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        byteAddress - Address of the first byte to read
        sizeInBytes - Number of bytes to be read
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        read bytes
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int byteAddress,
                       byte[] data)
                throws STException
        High level byte write function for Vicinity tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modify, change the bytes to be written then write the blocks
        Specified by:
        writeBytes in interface VicinityMemoryCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        byteAddress - Address of the first byte to update
        data - Data to be update
        Throws:
        STException

                       byte[] uid)

      • readSingleBlock

        public byte[] readSingleBlock(int blockOffset,
                              byte flag,
                              byte[] uid)
                       throws STException
        Read Single Block function with blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 2-byte array value to be used with readSingleBlock function
        Parameters:
        blockOffset - address of the block to be read (integer)
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeSingleBlock

        public byte writeSingleBlock(int blockOffset,
                             byte[] buffer,
                             byte flag,
                             byte[] uid)
                      throws STException
        Write Single Block function with blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 2-byte array value to be used with writeSingleBlock function
        Parameters:
        blockOffset - address of the block to be written (integer)
        buffer - Data to write
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException
